Our Treatments

Bespoke solutions for every patient

We use state-of-the-art technology and the highest quality biocompatible materials.

Single Tooth Implant

If only one or two teeth are missing, opting for a single implant to support a crown can be a worthwhile solution. In comparison, traditional bridges often require the alteration of adjacent healthy teeth to function correctly.

Book Your Free Consultation

Multi Tooth Implants

One of the most significant advantages of opting for dental implants is that they fuse with the jawbone when appropriately done, allowing them to last as long as permanent teeth. This also provides solid foundations for multiple-tooth or full-arch dental restorations.

Book Your Free Consultation

Both Jaws

involves surgically implanting titanium implants or posts into the jawbone where you used to have teeth to serve as artificial roots for your prosthodontics

Book Your Free Consultation

Full Arch Implants (All-on-X)

They offer a permanent solution for replacing all teeth in one arch (either the lower or upper jaw), thereby providing a stable, natural-looking smile and enhancing chewing function.

Book Your Free Consultation

All-on-X (AOX) Dental Implants

Dental implant surgery involves surgically placing a small, screw-like post (the implant) into the jawbone to replace a missing tooth root and then attaching a replacement tooth (such as a crown, bridge, or denture) to it.

Book Your Free Consultation

Denture Stabilisation

Stabilised dentures are increasing in popularity at present, and having implants inserted into the jawbone leads to the possibility of other restoration solutions, such as crowns and bridges. Having dentures firmly secured to implants can significantly improve your quality of life.

Book Your Free Consultation

Why choose
dental implants?

Implants are not just an aesthetic improvement; they are an investment in your long-term health. Unlike traditional dentures, implants prevent bone loss and offer unmatched stability.

Natural Look & Feel

Designed to look, feel, and function exactly like your natural teeth.

Permanent Solution

With proper care, dental implants can last a lifetime, unlike bridges or dentures.

Preserves Bone

Implants stimulate bone growth and prevent the loss of facial structure and jawbone density.

Eat What You Like

Recover up to 99% of your bite force. Enjoy your favourite foods without restriction.

The Process

Your journey to a new smile

01

Implant Assessment

We assess your oral health with state-of-the-art 3D scanners and design a bespoke treatment plan.

02

Bone Augmentation

If necessary, we build up the bone structure to ensure a solid foundation for your new implants.

03

Implant Placement

Painless surgical intervention under local anaesthetic to place the titanium implant into the bone.

04

Implant Stabilisation Period

A healing period (osseointegration) where the implant fuses with the jawbone to create a permanent root.

05

Placing New Teeth

We fit your custom-made crown, bridge, or fixed denture onto the stabilised implants.

06

Complete Smile

Your treatment is complete. You leave the clinic ready to smile, eat, and speak with confidence.

We understand that every patient is unique. Times may vary according to your specific healing and treatment needs.
